title: I fucking hate fizz

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9HQrWULM,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-10-04T16:41:57.071+0000)
>
> Yeah...not sure why it does damage.

Because otherwise he would never use his E offensively. It doing damage means he has to decide whether to use it to escape and dodge abilities or to jump in for the damage, but lose his defensive ability for a critical time. If his E did not do damage he would literally never use it except to disengage or dodge something.

The better question is why Ekko's ult does damage. And not a small amount.

It forces you to guard his ghost while.... not being near his ghost...
*counter-play!*

That's how counterplay works, though.

You have options, each has its risks (the first risks taking damage if you're too close, too far will make escape easier), and he has options that has risks. Counterplay isn't completely reducing risk (even Banshee's veil can be popped early on purpose by the enemy), it's playing around your opponent while they play around you. Like chess, the queen seems overpowered but she can be taken down just like the rest.

Ekko can't aim his ult, so he needs to time or position four seconds ahead of time if he wants to use it optimally. A panic ult wastes decent initiation, and a late ult can be pointless. If you don't want to be hit by the ghost, you risk letting him go. The counterplay to that entire idea is just having the cc tank or whoever is tanky and has some way to grab him stand at the ghost, and not standing by it if you're a squishy. There you go.

>The counterplay to that entire idea is just having the cc tank or whoever is tanky and has some way to grab him stand at the ghost, and not standing by it if you're a squishy. There you go.

*You're the CC tank:* Guard his ghost to CC him encase he ults, or chase and CC him hoping he doesn't.
Lose either way.

*You're the Damage source:* Chase him and let him potentially escape with his ult. Or guard his ghost and let him kill you with it.
Lose either way.

His ult creates false decisions because you lose no matter what he does.

------------------------------

Make no mistake. I'm not calling Ekko toxic, OP, or anything of the sort. But from a design/game-play perspective, I don't understand the logic behind his ult.

Cinematic: Ekko goes back in time to try again.

Gameplay: Ekko creates giant explosion and probably runs away.

You're definitely not wrong there :P It it were up to me, I'd have his ult do absolutely no damage and reduce his cooldowns (or maybe just his E cooldown...) by a couple seconds. But that would probably add to his mobility, even if hypothetically it reduced his burst, but whatever. That might break him more, who knows? I'm not balance.

And I figured we were talking in a teamfighting scenario. One person chases him, the other hangs by his ghost if your goal is to catch him. If Ekko ults, cc tank holds him down while dps does a 180 and destroys him. In laning... well, let's be thankful he's basically a jungler now, his jungle role is more popular and successful (and let's be real, if he was primarily a midlaner he'd be just as annoying as Fizz).

>And I figured we were talking in a teamfighting scenario.

Teamfight dynamics mess a lot of things up. But no. I'm talking strictly game-play/design.

All of her skills are mid-range skillshots or short/melee range. Idk, of all the annoying champs in the game or hard-to-dodge skillshots, Ahri is really low on the list for me. She can be slippery, but she's never invisible, never invulnerable, never spawns clones, doesn't have a million clutch shields, can't teleport-juke halfway across the map, and can't snipe you from 3000 range during a recall.

And if she's low, she won't disappear to god knows where. She can be hard to play against, but she's not the dishonorable bullshit we get with Fizz, Leblanc, Riven, etc.
